appearances.title: Fox News Live : FOXNEWSW : January 11, 2026 10:00am-11:00am PST
appearances.snippet: for more let's bring in republican congressman russell fry from south carolina.ks very much for joining us here. -- thanks very much. these protesters are asking for i.c.e. to get out of their communities, but do you think it has the the opposite effect? >> 100%. this administration, i think, is focused on doing what they said they were going to do, remove these people and repatriate them back to their country of origin to. these protests, the violent nature of them, the harassment, secretary noem talked about the number of incidents, you know, over a hundred incidents where cars have been used against our i.c.e. officials. i.c.e. official death threats are up 8,000% since the start of this administration. assaults against i.c.e. officials are up 1300%. and so this is, i think, going to have the opposite effect as this administration and republicans in congress continue to support law and order. and support our men and women who are doing their job. rich: one of the things the protester in c.b.'s report had to say was that the door to door raids, the knocking on

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 7, 2026 6:20pm-7:12pm EST
appearances.snippet: speaker, i rise today in support of the shower act led by my colleague, representative russell fry. you know, over the last several years, americans have seen firsthand what happens when a radical regulatory agenda takes over washington. the previous administration, it's sad to say, inserted itself into nearly every aspect of american life, raising costs and imposing rules that made no sense for american families. one of the clearest examples is what they did. believe it or not, to our showers, they twisted the law to claim you can't make this stuff up, that the 2.5 gallon per minute standard is applied to the entire shower system, instead of just each individual shower head. you can't make this. frankly, i think they were all wet. the result was weaker water pressure and daily frustration for homeowners, all in the name of government control. for a year now, this congress has worked to reverse the damage left behind by previous administrations. mr. speaker, the shower act is simply another step in that effort. it locks in the law's original intent and ensures that future leftist ad

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 7, 2026 12:01pm-1:14pm EST
appearances.snippet: i would like to recognize representative halton and russell fry, as well as our republican leadership and the appropriations committee, led by chairman cole, for leadership on these critical pieces of legislation being considered. and i urge congress to pass these common sense bills to lower the cost of living not only for buckeye families, but for families across america. thank you. speaker i yield back. >> gentleman reserves. gentleman from massachusetts. >> thank you, mr. speaker. mr. speaker, i want to i want to tell everybody a little secret here. um, the republicans are really clever, but not really as clever as they think they are. the big, beautiful bill that they passed. you know, the one that includes tax cuts for multi-millionaires and multi-billionaires and the one that guts medicaid by $1 trillion is incredibly unpopular. it is incredibly unpopular. in fact, uh, the kaiser family foundation said that 64% of americans oppose it, 64%. and get this even fox news, even fox news, they say that 59% of the american people oppose it. and why do they oppose it? and why is it so un
